comments:
build I20040619-2000 (RC3)

- switched to this build from I20040618-0800
- ctrl+B
- it did a full build, because the set of installed plug-ins had changed (I had
installed another plug-in)
- got the following compilation error:

Description: A class file was not written. The project may be inconsistent, if
so try refreshing this project and building it
File: PerspectiveListenerListOld.java	
In Folder: org.eclipse.ui.workbench/Eclipse UI/org/eclipse/ui/internal

I had not modified this file, or any others in this project or its
prerequisites, outside of the workspace.

Tried refresh the whole workspace, and Ctrl+B again, and it was a no-op (error
not fixed).

Noticed the following in the log, which occurred around the time of the build.
This stack here looks like a dup of bug 66288.

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 374 Jun 21, 2004 12:16:31.679
!MESSAGE Resource /org.eclipse.ui.workbench/bin/org/eclipse/ui/internal already
exists.

Did a Clean on org.eclipse.ui.workbench.  The build then fixed up the error.

After the Clean but before the build, the Problems view was stuck updating.
That is, it was still showing the error (even though the marker had been
deleted), and its tab title was still in italics.
The Package Explorer cleared the error decoration OK, which suggests that the
marker was properly deleted.

I believe this hang has been reported against the Problems view already, but
can't find the PR right now.  

Is it possible that the builder or compiler is not properly releasing a
workspace lock when this happens?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 67952 ***
